metadata.title: {siteName} Cookie Policy
metadata.description: Learn how {siteName} uses cookies, local storage, and how you can control them.

intro.heading: {siteName} Cookie Policy
intro.description: This policy explains how we use cookies, localStorage, and similar technologies inside {siteName}, and how you can manage them. It forms part of the <terms>Terms of Service</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.

cookieTypes.title: Cookies we use
cookieTypes.description: We follow a "necessity-first" approach: we only write cookies to maintain login sessions or remember interface preferences. Any analytics or experiment script requires your explicit consent through the banner.

rows.name: access_token
rows.storage: HTTPOnly cookie set by the Go API
rows.purpose: Keeps you signed in so the dashboard and API requests can securely recognize your account. It clears when the browser closes or the session expires.

rows.name: refresh_token
rows.storage: HTTPOnly cookie set by the Go API
rows.purpose: Silently refreshes access tokens when they expire, reducing the need to log in again. We send it over HTTPS and restrict access to backend services only.

rows.name: sidebar_state
rows.purpose: Remembers whether the dashboard sidebar is collapsed or expanded so the layout stays consistent on your next visit.

rows.name: admin_cookie_consent
rows.purpose: Stores the privacy preference you set within the footer banner so we respect your accept or reject choice. The value updates immediately when you change the selection.

optional.title: Optional cookie scenarios
optional.description: We only enable the following practices after you choose "Accept all" on the banner:
items: To evaluate whether new components or animations improve usability, we only collect aggregated metrics (such as dwell time or load duration) and write them to the browser after consent.
We may temporarily enable error-monitoring scripts to capture anonymous console stack traces solely for debugging without linking to personal identities.
If you reject optional cookies, those scripts stay disabled and we avoid creating any new third-party tracking identifiers.

items.label: Via banner:
items.description: Use the login or home page cookie banner any time to reject optional cookies or accept them again.

items.label: Browser settings:
items.description: Clear cookies or block third-party cookies inside your browser's privacy or security settings.

items.label: Withdraw consent:
items.description: If you've accepted optional cookies, clear admin_cookie_consent or choose "Reject" on the banner to disable related scripts immediately.

items.label: Contact us:
items.trailing: and we'll help adjust your cookie preferences.
